Employee: Former  Key  in Houston, Texas
Description: [' Free food, great health and dental benefits']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Greenwood, Indiana
Description: [" free food for everyone who doesn't make tip outs. only for one store chosen meal though, so not very helpful for people with dietary restrictions. other benefits include stress and anxiety and lower wages. nothing good to see here."]

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Woodland Hills, California
Description: [' There is no real benefit package, there is a health insurance plan but very expensive for what you get.']

Employee: Former  Host  in Addison, Texas
Description: [' I worked full-time hours at one point but had a PT schedule so I did not qualify for benefits since I technically was not a FT employee.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Vienna, Virginia
Description: [" there's no benefits unless your a manager."]

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Oviedo, Florida
Description: [" There wasn't many other than discounted food. 50% off for tip-based shifts, 100% for non-tip shifts, 25% when dining in,"]

Employee: Former  Food Server  in Woodland, California
Description: [' The ad said they needed full time staff and have an extensive benefits package, but for each job I was qualified for that they were also advertising for, there were ZERO full time positions and each person hired with me also only got part time work.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Round Rock, Texas
Description: [' The only good thing was the employee meal, But that is only time permitted.... I did work double shifts and not given a 30 min break']

Employee: Former  Takeout, Food Runner, Server  in San Bruno, California
Description: [" The GM was AMAZING. He actually cares about all of his staff from hosts to SA's to Bartenders. Getting half off of food everyday saved me a lot of money."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Fort Worth, Texas
Description: [' You have to work an entire 6 months before you are eligible for benefits.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Huntington Beach, California
Description: [' Provider network was great and was able to select great physicians']

Employee: Current  Dishwasher/Prep Cook  in Fremont, California
Description: [' 30 day probation before person gets benefits']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Katy, Texas
Description: [" Expensive and deductible didn't cover anything"]

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Cupertino, California
Description: [' Benefits package is a joke. You can only qualify if you work an average of 35 hours per week during a quarter. As well a you must maintain that average afterwards. Therefore if you take a vacation for a week, your average will dropped and you will be dropped off of coverage. This happened to me. That pretty much prevents someone who needs that health coverage to ever take a vacation.']

Employee: Former  Host/Hostess  in Phoenix, Arizona
Description: [' Free food when you work and are a non tipped employee. Get to choose from a decent list of options.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Cedar Park, Texas
Description: [' The benefits package is nonexistent to most employees....they are "allotted" only so many full time positions at each restaurant and most of them are BOH staff. FOH staff very rarely get full time hours and then benefits don\'t kick in until you\'ve worked full time hours for 6 or 9 months.']

Employee: Former  Restaurant Manager  in Irvine, California
Description: [' Benefits package was substantial and at the better end of most corporate restaurants. The offer a full range of benefits including paid vacation, health, dental, vision, 401k, etc...']

Employee: Former  Server  in Temple, Texas
Description: [" You can kiss time off good-bye. I don't know of any benefits due to the fact that they wont let anyone work more than 40 hours in a week."]

Employee: Current  Host Desk Coordinator  in Roseville, California
Description: [' free meal from limited menu if you work a minimum of 2 hours per shift for non-gratuity employees. Gratuity employees pay 50%']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Lewisville, Texas
Description: [" Wasn't a benefits package while I was there."]

Employee: Former  Manager  in San Antonio, Texas
Description: [' Vacation time hard to schedule due to so many blackout periods.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Norman, Oklahoma
Description: [" There isn't much that is offered, since it is a restaurant. You are permitted to ask off, you just have to get your shift covered. There is an easy to use app, HotSchedules, that makes all of that easy. They are pretty good about letting you off work if you're really sick or an emergency happens."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Sacramento, California
Description: [' If you are given stocks you are taxed very heavily on them. The medical insurance varies by state and was affected poorly by Obamacare. The free meals are wonderful and can be used at every location.']

Employee: Former  Server  in College Station, Texas
Description: [" You're presented with the opportunities as soon as you're hired. To get paid time off you have to work for at least a year. Very lenient with time off before then though."]

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Roseville, California
Description: [" Most team members don't get enough hours to receive benefits."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Redmond, Washington State
Description: [' No benefits besides flexible scheduling and a 50% discount. Time off was easily arranged.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Lexington-Fayette, Kentucky
Description: [' You are considered part time for the first six months of employment. As so, I was never aware of any benefits the company offered. During working hours, I was able to get half off of food.']

Employee: Former  Dishwasher  in Santa Rosa, California
Description: [' Full-time employment means benefits, which means that full-time staff had their hours cut during my year of employment.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Folsom, California
Description: [' There is no benefits package because no is full time.']

Employee: Former  Service Assistant  in Tampa, Florida
Description: [' there was no benefits package for working here. I was part-time so nothing was available to me']

Employee: Former  Server  in Escondido, California
Description: [' Employee discount meal program, adequate health insurance although its costly']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Moreno Valley, California
Description: [" The best part is the offer everything. 401k, health insurance, life insurance, and vacation. The worst part is they keep making it harder to get these benefits. I worked there 10 years and now you only get 3.4 hours if you work 35 hours a pay period. It use to be 30 hours and it use to 4.9 hours. To get health you must have 34+ hours it use to be 30. They keep changing it so pretty much unless you're a cook you'll never see any of these benefits."]

Employee: Current  Host/Hostess  in Anaheim, California
Description: [' You can only get one free meal a shift and you cant get 2 if you work a double']

Employee: Former  Supervisor/Bartender/Server  in Austin, Texas
Description: [' Well, to be eligible for benefits you have to be considered a full time employee. As a server you are not allowed to work full time hours. They track your hours and when you are approaching the threshold for full time eligibility, you are either not allowed to work or they will call you off for your shift saying something like, its a slow day or we are overstaffed so take the night off. Luckily I was a supervisor and a cook as well so I was able to get the hours I needed.']

Employee: Former  Server  in College Station, Texas
Description: [' I did not receive benefits because I was not there full time. But, they do offer insurance to full time employees and benefits to managers.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Lancaster, Pennsylvania
Description: [' Vacation, 401k match, health plans.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Fort Worth, Texas
Description: [" If you're a non tipped worker you get free food after your shift. If you're a tipped worker you get 50% off food unless you work a double"]

Employee: Former  Director of Operations  in Jacksonville, Florida
Description: [' Health insurance offered to employees that work over 30 hours.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Irvine, California
Description: [' flexible schedule, most employees are part time']

Employee: Former  Service Assistant  in Roseville, California
Description: [' You got an employee discount and that was pretty much it unless you were management or had worked there for 4+ years. Not a great deal.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Irvine, California
Description: [' Half off food, Free food when we roll out something new, and 25% of when you come into the restaurant on a day you didnt work']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Cupertino, California
Description: [' Could request time off ahead of time using hot schedules, able to go to company training meetings, % off of food.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Laguna Hills, California
Description: [' The Give A Slice program is awesome! Employee contribute to a fund to help coworkers when faced with financial situations due to illness or medical emergencies.']

Employee: Former  Host  in Allen, Texas
Description: [" I was a part time employee, so I personally don't know about the benefits packages and things like that."]

Employee: Former  AGM  in San Antonio, Texas
Description: [" Great vacation, 401k and ESPP for GM's. Great all together plan and executed well by the team in California."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [' They work around your schedule.']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Redmond, Washington State
Description: [' It is fairly easy to get time off and most of the time the company is willing to work around your schedule.']

Employee: Current  Hostess  in Temple, Texas
Description: [' They genuinely try to give you the time off you need.']

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Webster, Texas
Description: [' No health insurance, no paid time off, no sick leave, no 401k, no stock options']

Employee: Current  Server  in Katy, Texas
Description: [" Only full-time (30 hours) gets access to health care and they won't allow most servers enough hours to qualify because of the new health plan. Servers who qualify can test to get a 'green apron' which offers a $150 one-time bonus and $50 quarterly."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Tampa, Florida
Description: [" BJ's has partial matching for up to 6% of your salaryt on 401K. Medical is pretty good at the manager level"]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Oxnard, California
Description: [' Good discount on meals when you worked, very tempting to spend all your money on their food. Also included a drink.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Columbus, Ohio
Description: [' Not available at the time of employment']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Denver, Colorado
Description: [" It's great to have a 401k offered to even low level employees. They matched 3% for a limited time. The health care they offered before the mandate of the new legislation was much better. I guess having it available means they personally want to spend less money so the coverage is not so great now. For instance, I went to the hospital a few months ago...$6000 in med bills yet only about $500 was covered and I've basically met my deductible for the year with that since the deductible is $5500 I believe. Same thing with glasses...it covered my eye exam and abut $50 of the rest so I still ended up footing about $400 even with basic cheap frames. The health care isn't worth the price. Free meal for hourly non tipped team members and 50% off for tipped, when at work. When coming in off the clock 25% for you and your guests."]

Employee: Former  Restaurant Manager  in Waco, Texas
Description: [' 401K, matching savings plan and paid vacation with time accrued. Pretty good set up for Benefits package for self, spouse can be expensive to add in. Family is a little more than what it cost to add just a spouse.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Houston, Texas
Description: [" There is non lol, so there is no possibility oIf getting a benefits package at BJ's unless maybe your a cook who works full time. If you are a server. Forget About It"]

Employee: Former  Server  in Laurel, Maryland
Description: [' You had to work 40 hours a week, which the management had individual favorites whom they would always schedule more and give them better hours and sections so it was like a cut throat war with fellow employees trying to fight for shifts.']

Employee: Former  Senior Manager  in San Mateo, California
Description: [' the worst thing is that a lot of the time we are short managers and its really hard to plan your vacations when you plan on taking one because there wont be enough coverage. Plus the vacation hours maxed out if you reach a certain amount and you start to lose them if you do not use them.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Houston, Texas
Description: [" It's essentially non-existent, because you have to consistently work 35-40 hours a week for three months straight, and they don't let you do that for scheduling purposes."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [" benefits package at BJ's Restaurants was very basic. Did not have flex account cards available through the insurbnace carrier."]

Employee: Current  Operations  in Huntington Beach, California
Description: [' Great health insurance, 401k, dental and vision.']

Employee: Current  Server Assistant  in Katy, Texas
Description: [' Double pay during your yearly anniversary, two checks.']

Employee: Current  Senior Manager  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Great Benefits package, helped me immensely']

Employee: Current  Bj's Brewhouse Server  in Round Rock, Texas
Description: [' Health insurance really sucks... covers $10,000 a year...']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Company paid a very high percentage. My spouse and I were covered for $100 a paycheck(medical/dental/vision).']

Employee: Former  Food Server  in Norman, Oklahoma
Description: [' Servers got half-off of even the higher quality, most expensive food items.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Fort Collins, Colorado
Description: [' Good discounts. Free meals for kitchen staff.']
